Matthias, that sounds right to me.  JNEAT is based on my original NEAT
C++ =
code, and I believe the variable names are mainly equivalent.  If
you are c=
ollecting stats or looking for the overall champ, then

obably what you care about.

> First of all, I'm using the Java version of NEAT (JNEAT), maybe the 
> f=
itness variables are named differently in the C+ NEAT, but I think 
> you w=
ill all understand my question. It's about the difference 
> between the tw=
o variables "fitness" and "orig_fitness". 
> The way I understand this is t=
he following:
> 1a. orig_fitness is the organism's real fitness value, whic=
h is 
> determined only once, when the organism is created and evaluated.
>=
 1b. orig_fitness never changes.
> 2a. fitness, on the other hand, is subje=
ct of later adjustments. Two 
> processes can change the value of fitness: =

> 2b. First, fitness is divided among the subjects of the same species, 
>=
 meaning the more organisms in one species, the lower the fitness.
> 2c. Se=
cond, age_significance allows nishing by raising the fitness of 
> young or=
ganisms.
> 3. When deciding which organism is better than another, orig_fit=
ness 
> is the only logic choice. Fitness is only a internal value for NEAT=
 
> and not important for me, who wants only the one and only best 
> organ=
ism at the end.
> 
> If someone could help me out and tell me if all of the=
 above

w it
